html:
Hello!

Welcome back, developers! We hope your break was refreshing and youâ€™re ready for new challenges. ðŸ˜Š

Here are some resources to sharpen your skills and have fun along the way:

The Best Dispatcher for a Backend Framework.

Choosing the right dispatcher for your backend can greatly impact performance and resource usage. This detailed exploration compares options like Dispatchers.IO, Dispatchers.Default, and more.

Learn why a limited parallelism dispatcher or virtual threads (Loom) might be your best choice.

Read the detailed comparison

Jetpack Compose Modifier Guessing Game.

If you work with Kotlin and Jetpack Compose, hereâ€™s a fun way to test your understanding of modifiers. The Jetpack Compose Modifier Guessing Game presents a component with different modifiers and asks you to guess the output. Levels range from easy to extreme, and itâ€™s built using Compose Multiplatform with Wasm, running smoothly on desktop and mobile.

To Play Click Here

Key Features:

  • Supports various modifiers like size(), padding(), clip(), and more.
  • Displays only unique outcomes, ensuring a challenging and engaging experience.
  • Four difficulty levels to match your expertise: Easy, Medium, Hard, and Extreme.

Read the full article

How Do You Keep Your Kotlin Code Crystal Clear?ðŸ‘‡

Readable and maintainable code is a hallmark of great developers. This article dives into the essentials of KDoc and Dokka, offering best practices to document your Kotlin projects effectively. Learn how to make your code self-explanatory and easier to maintain.

Read the full article

Java and Kotlin Versions in Android: When to Upgrade and When to Avoid. ðŸ‘‡

New versions can bring performance boosts and compatibility improvements, but not every update is right for every project. This article helps you determine the best time to upgrade Java and Kotlin versions for your Android development, avoiding potential pitfalls.

Read the full article
